document_data.name: Levia Shadewalker
document_data.mainbody: '''Levia Shadewalker''' was the [[half-elf]] spymistress of the [[Eye of Justice]] in [[Westgate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Relationships: Levia was [[Gedrin Thalavar]]'s apprentice{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice|99}} and she considered herself his adopted daughter.<ref>{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice|?}}
document_data.Description: Levia had slightly pointed ears due to her [[elf|elven]] heritage. She wasn't pretty, a fact she was painfully aware of.{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice|1250}}
document_data.Possessions: Levia owned a [[magic item|magical]] [[ring]] that slowed time.{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice|2273}} She wore [[brigandine]] armor and wielded a [[mace]].{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice|1052}}
document_data.History:
In the {{YearlinkName|1470}}, [[Kalen Dren]] journeyed to Westgate and revealed to the Eye of Justice that he was the heir to the blade ''[[Vindicator]]'', Gedrin's [[sword]] that was once wielded by the [[god]] [[Helm]]. Kalen became Levia's apprentice and she trained him in spycraft and martial skills.{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice|269}}

In the {{YearlinkName|1480}}, [[Rhetegast Hawkwinter]], the heir to the Shadowbane title, journeyed to Westgate to train with Levia. She groomed him to be the new Shadowbane and he crusaded throughout the city. Later that year, Kalen showed up in Westgate, looking for Rhett but Levia didn't reveal Rhett's whereabouts. When Levia learned that [[Ilira Nathalan]] was living in Westgate, she ambushed Ilira in an attempt to bring her to justice for the crimes she supposedly committed, though Ilira escaped.{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice|3643}}
